repnme.cdata!:
Morocco - National Agricultural Credit
            Project and National Rural Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the combined Implementation
            Completion Report (ICR) for the National Agricultural Credit
            Project and the National Rural Finance Project made to the
            Caisse Nationale de Credit Agricole (CNCA) and guaranteed by
            the Kingdom of Morocco. The combined outcome of both
            projects credit lines is rated unsatisfactory as well as
            performance of borrower and Bank is rated highly
            unsatisfactory. Lessons learned from these projects are as
            follows: (i) the Bank must systematically check that its
            analytical vigilance is not weakened by long-term
            relationships of trust established with its clients. In
            particular, warning signals issued at various Bank levels
            and more specifically by Operations Evaluation Department
            (OED) must be followed by accurate and appropriate
            investigations ensuring that lending operations are soundly
            based. A similar attitude must prevail as far as the
            relationship between the Banks client and the sub-borrowers
            is concerned. (ii) sub loan criteria must be neither
            neglected nor minimized, whether they are quantitative
            (Financial Rate of Return  and Economic Rate of Retum ) or
            qualitative. Careful reviews of the conditions under which
            the credit line is used and further supervised by the
            borrower can detect borrowers failures or unnecessary
            risk-taking. (iii) Finally, Bank management must review the
            assertions of project teams and systematically challenge
            those assertions. This will ensure that they are reliable
            and based on solid information.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will assist Morocco in
            meeting national objectives set by the Government and the
            Caisse Nationale de Credit Agricole (CNCA) for agricultural
            credit for 1989-93. Specifically the project will fund over
            a four year implementation period: (i) medium- and long-term
            credit to private farmers and investors in the agricultural
            sector to finance a wide range of investments including
            irrigation, farm equipment, tree crop and livestock
            development, storage facilities, land improvement, coastal
            fisheries, and working capital for private agro-processing
            exporters; and (ii) project related training, consulting
            services for the strengthening of CNCA management and
            planning, and construction or rehabilitation of a new
            tranche (1989-93) of CNCA's branch network and offices.
